page.title: 07St Annes - Tourist Interview
page.content: Tourists were interviewed in the Square; People came from Oldham and Scotland,others from Huddersfield, Halifax and Gloucestershire.They were attracted to St Annes because it was peaceful,clean,a seaside area,had plenty of shops,good bowling greens and the golf courses.People who had been here before noted improved shopping facilities and a new 'image'.Two people felt there was less to do now.One complained that the front was 'tatty'.Everyone was enjoying themselves,particularly when the weather was good.Most people said there was enough to do in the daytime but not at night.One would have liked a theatre,another dancing.An elderly man felt there was enough to do but a middle-aged couple felt there was enough,for a few days.
